snippet.title: Australian medical organisation assists with Pacific cervical cancer screening
snippet.content: An Australian medical service which is assisting several Pacific countries says a shift in how testing for cervical cancer is carried out good be good news for our region. Victorian Cytology Service in Melbourne is partnering with the Wantok Health Foundation in PNG's West New Britain province to help with testing for the disease. Annette Ketalu from Wantok Health, says they want to cut the incidence of cervical cancer in the province in half within five years. Executive Director of VCS, Associate Professor Marion Saville, tells Bruce Hill that a shift towards testing for the human papillomavirus, or HPV, rather than cervical cancer directly may in fact save more lives in the Pacific.
